title: How to Provide the Right Light Requirements for Indoor Plants

steps.headline: Check lighting levels where plants are showing signs of yellowing or they're falling off in great number.
steps.description:
These can indicate inadequate light. (They can also indicate too much watering during the wintering months.) Yellowed or brown patches might mean that the plant has been scorched by sunlight. Move it away from the window or skylights. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

"} Check lighting levels where plants are showing signs of yellowing or they're falling off in great number. These can indicate inadequate light. (They can also indicate too much watering during the wintering months.) Yellowed or brown patches might mean that the plant has been scorched by sunlight. Move it away from the window or skylights. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Provide-the-Right-Light-Requirements-for-Indoor-Plants-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"
